description: I like this app. It is based on Audacity. It opens for me in dark mode which I prefer. I have just started using it. It would be amazing if they built the UI to look like Adobe Audition.
summary: Great audio editing app based on Audacity

description: Audacity got bought by a company that puts telemetry and their cloud service in. Tenacity is the decrapified community variant without that stuff and even some new features.
Would've been the definitive fork if it wasn't for the drama over naming.

Look, I *want* to like this, but it has two very significant problems right now compared to vanilla Audacity:

1. Multiple instances of Tenacity causes the instances to break.
2. The GUI refuses to update smoothly, making it hard to tell when a piece of audio aligns with a certain second or waveform spike.

I get that Audacity is tracking users and selling info, but at least their product works. I installed and booted up Audacity less than 5 minutes ago and it's already smooth as silk, compared to Tenacity. Once these issues are fixed, I'll happily switch back.
summary: Tenacity has major issues; I'm going back to Audacity

description: It has more themes, and works just fine like Audacity, and is telemetry-less.
summary: Prob the best Audacity alt out there

description: It is probably the way it was packed into a flatpak but the UI is a bit broken. Even so it beats audacity by margins.

Fonctionne comem on s'attend à ce que l'appli fonctionne, c'est à dire: elle fait le job (c'est un fork d'audacity après tout)
Mais l'appli est moche (malgré plusieurs thèmes inclus, elle reste tout de même très fonctionnelle) et surtout très lente...
Зачем нужен этот форк, когда есть красивый и вылизанный Audacity.
